page.title: 13MEDIA
page.content: Most houses in the area have tele- vision but it is not possible yet to get Channel 4. Most people also have a radio and some have videos. Newspapers are delivered from the newsagent at Wearhead and the Post Office at St. John's Chapel. Those for people in outlying areas are left for collection from boxes on or near the main road. Sunday papers are brought by car from Stanhope. The council publishes a free weekly 'The Wear Valley Advertiser'. A monthly parish magazine 'The Source' is the joint publication of the Meth- odist and Aglican Churches. Every 2 or 3 years the Weardale Field Study Society publish a magazine 'The Bonny Moor Hen'. 2 mobile library vans from Crook cover the area once a fortnight. They have an excellent ordering serv- ice and will also obtain new books for borrowers who wish to buy.
